nameEntry.part: Dalmar Child and Family Care, Wesley Mission

biogHist.abstract:
The type and amount of information contained within these files varies, with the earlier files being less comprehensive than the later ones. On the earlier files (e.g. 1893-c.1940s), there might only be an admission sheet which records the child's name, date of birth, and reason for admission. Occasionally there might be an adoption agreement form on the file. Later files may contain information about parents and other family members, schooling and medical reports, case notes and correspondence about the child.
Quantity: 6 filing cabinets (approx.)
Access Access to information held by Dalmar is generally limited to the person to whom that information relates. In order to access information about himself or herself, a person must be able to prove their identity before information is released. This may mean having to produce a birth certificate, driver's licence or other such form of identification. A person may access information about another person provided the person who is the subject of the information gives their permission to the person seeking access. In the event that the person to whom the information relates is deceased, the person seeking access must provide proof of that person's death, and of their relationship to that person.
Contact Dalmar has an Aftercare Program, for people who once lived at Dalmar or were in its foster care programs. The After Care Support Officer assists people to access their files and provides an opportunity to talk about what it was like for you when you lived in care. Dalmar also provides a free assessment and treatment program through Wesley Private Hospital's psychology service. People wishing to access their files should first call or write to the After Care Support Officer.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'Client files', in Find & Connect - New South Wales,
Resource: Connecting Kin: Guide to Records

imprint.publisher: New South Wales Department of Community Services
